alert.note: Alert for Sierra (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued September 17 at 3:45PM MDT until September 17 at 4:30PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: The National Weather Service in El Paso has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Sierra County in south central New Mexico... * Until 430 PM MDT. * At 344 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 4 miles southeast of Winston, moving southeast at 7 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated and public reports of large damaging hail. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Cuchillo, Winston, San Miguel, Alamosa Canyon, Chise, Upper Palomas Canyon, and Las Placitas. This includes Interstate 25 in New Mexico between mile markers 84 and 88. HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move immediately to shelter inside a strong building. Stay away from windows. This storm is producing large hail. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows!
